vote.title: To authorize the Director of the Department of Neighborhoods to enter into a grant agreement with Heart of Job Foundation, a not-for-profit organization in support of a year-long partnership with Columbus City Preparatory School for Boys and to authorize the expenditure from the General Fund for programming. ($12,500.00)
vote.description:
Explanation
 
Background
This ordinance authorizes the Director of the Department of Neighborhoods to enter into grant agreement with the not-for-profit agency Heart of Job Foundation. 
The mission of Heart of Job Foundation (HOJ) is to provide STEAM and Career Technical Education through workforce development programs that lead to family-sustaining careers.  HOJ is seeking grant funding for a year-long partnership with Columbus City Preparatory School for Boys that integrates social-emotional growth, wellness, and career exploration into the middle school experience. Through weekly programming, biannual resource distribution, and a culminating Field Day celebration, the initiative will strengthen student resilience, foster community engagement, and expand career readiness opportunities in alignment with HOJ’s mission.  Existing city employees lack the skills necessary to provide the programming to be offered.  While the grant at issue will support male youths, the overall mission of the Foundation is to support arts communication and media education for all youths.
 
Fiscal Impact: This ordinance authorizes the expenditure of $12,500.00 from the General Fund.
Contract Compliance: Heart of Job Foundation CC-041659, exp. 4/23/2026
 
Title
 
To authorize the Director of the Department of Neighborhoods to enter into a grant agreement with Heart of Job Foundation, a not-for-profit organization in support of a year-long partnership with Columbus City Preparatory School for Boys and to authorize the expenditure from the General Fund for programming. ($12,500.00)
 
Body
 
WHEREAS, there is a need to support a program that integrates social-emotional growth, wellness, and career exploration into the middle school experience; and
WHEREAS, the grant funds will be used to support this not-for-profit agency to establish a year-long partnership with Columbus City Preparatory School for Boys; and
WHEREAS, such expenditure of funds has been accounted for within the 2025 Budget; and 
WHEREAS, it has become necessary in the usual daily operation of the Department of Neighborhoods to authorize the Director to enter into a grant agreement with Heart of Job Foundation; now, therefore,
 
 
BE IT ORDAINED BY THE COUNCIL OF THE CITY OF COLUMBUS:
SECTION 1. That the Director of the Department of Neighborhoods is authorized to enter into a grant agreement with Heart of Job Foundation for a year-long partnership with Columbus City Preparatory School for Boys.
 
SECTION 2. That the expenditure of $12,500.00, or so much thereof as may be needed, is authorized in Fund 1000, Dept-Div 48-01, in object class 05 (Grants) per the accounting codes in the attachment to this ordinance.
SECTION 3. That the funds necessary to carry out the purpose of this ordinance are deemed appropriated, and the City Auditor shall establish such accounting codes as necessary.
SECTION 4. That the City Auditor is authorized to make any accounting changes to revise the funding source for all contracts or contract modifications associated with this legislation.
SECTION 5. That this ordinance shall take effect and be in force from and after the earliest period allowed by law.
